greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Completely multiplicative with a(p) = p if p = 6k+1 and a(p) = 1 otherwise.
comment: To compute a(n) replace primes not of the form 6k+1 in the prime factorization of n by 1.
The first place this sequence differs from A170824 is at n = 49.
For p prime, a(p) = p if p is a term in A002476 and a(p) = 1 if p = 2, p = 3 or p is a term in A007528.
a(n) is the largest term of A004611 that divides n. - _Peter Munn_, Mar 06 2021
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if A020639(n) = 1 (mod 6), a(n) = A020639(n) * a(A032742(n)), otherwise a(n) = a(A028234(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 09 2017
example: a(15) = 1 because 15 = 3*5 and neither of these primes is of the form 6k+1.
a(62) = 31 because 62 = 31*2, 31 = 6*5 + 1, and 2 is not of the form 6k+1.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := If[Mod[p, 6] == 1, p^e, 1]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 19 2020 *)
program: n=100; sixnplus1Primes=[x for x in primes_first_n(100) if (x-1)%6==0]
[prod([(x^(x in sixnplus1Primes))^y for x,y in factor(n)]) for n in [1..n]]
(PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, if ((f[i,1] - 1) % 6, f[i, 1] = 1);); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 11 2015
(Scheme) (define (A248909 n) (if (= 1 n) n (* (if (= 1 (modulo (A020639 n) 6)) (A020639 n) 1) (A248909 (A032742 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 09 2017
xref: Sequences used in a definition of this sequence: A002476, A004611, A007528, A020639, A028234, A032742.
results.author: _Tom Edgar_, Mar 06 2015
